function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Potential spread of sars-cov-2","Low-cost mass production of loc-based devices may lead to compromised quality control and increased risk of device malfunction","Widespread use of loc-based techniques for viral detection may create false positives or false negatives in diagnostic results","Development of lab-in-a-tube, lab-in-a-box, and lab on-a-drone systems for disease diagnosis","Rapid development and deployment of poct systems for pandemic diagnosis","Global emphasis on the need for rapid and sensitive detection techniques like biosensors","High lods for lassa fever, west nile fever, and influenza could lead to missed detection of the viruses in wastewater, increasing the risk of environmental contamination","Absence of a paper-based device to detect sars-cov-2 in wastewaters increases the risk of undetected viral presence in the environment and potential transmission","Endogenous biomarkers present in sewage systems can be used to estimate the real-time population served by the system, posing a risk of privacy invasion","The identification and monitoring of disease biomarkers in sewage systems could lead to the unintentional disclosure of health information of entire populations","Proteomic identification of disease biomarkers in sewage systems may lead to the unintentional tracking and monitoring of health conditions of different populations, potentially violating privacy and ethical standards","Complexity of wastewater matrix impacting detection methods","Discrepancies between laboratories due to factors such as qpcr platforms, pcr inhibitors, nucleic acid extraction efficiency, and low levels of targets","Large uncertainty in viral load in feces making it difficult to determine a typical value for wbe and comparison with clinical data","Inadequate adaptation of clinical technology to wbe","Lack of optimization in wastewater treatment technology for virus transmission control","Use of pcr technologies and endogenous biomarker measurements may lead to inaccurate identification of specific diseases","Inaccurate identification of specific diseases due to biomarkers not being specific to a given disease, leading to misdiagnosis and ineffective containment measures","Reliance on pcr for detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater","Lack of standardized evaluation and verification of rt-qpcr methods","Vulnerable children under 5 and pregnant women at heightened risk of vbds","Lack of understanding of the complex ways in which global changes affect human, animal, and natural systems","Continued high incidence and distribution of vectorborne diseases vbds","Vector-borne diseases transmitted by multiple species of vectors","Impact of climate change on vector populations","Ecosystem disturbances and biodiversity loss","Increased contact between biting insect vectors, animal hosts, and humans due to deforestation","Changes in vegetation and land cultivation dynamics due to deforestation shifting vector-animal relations","Reduced biodiversity and range of reservoir hosts impacting trypanosomiasis infection","Inadequate access to improved sanitation and drinking water","Impacts of water developments on ecosystems and spread of vector-borne diseases","Changes in agricultural practices leading to increased larval densities of disease-carrying mosquitoes","Water shortages leading to increased contact with snail-infested waters and more breeding sites for disease-carrying mosquitoes","Unplanned urbanization leading to proliferation of slums and inadequate sanitation, leading to increased vector-borne disease transmission","Dependence on foreign aid and outside experts","Complex dynamics and interconnectivities of global changes","Inevitability of increased vulnerability, infection, and epidemics due to global change","Poverty increases vulnerability to vector-borne diseases vbds by limiting people’s ability to cope with health risks","Complex interplay of social, cultural, economic, and environmental factors contributes to vulnerability to vbds","Limited access to social services and resources","Inequitable health governance and access to diagnosis, treatment, and prevention","Difficulties in prioritization as elimination-targeted diseases become less common at community and country levels","Emphasis on unsustainable pilot studies","Increase in the range of local snail host due to changes in the marshland ecosystem and sociodemographic shifts","Bureaucratic and institutional inflexibility leading to lack of tailored approaches","Lack of evidence on the impact of community-based approaches on epidemiological trends and cost-effectiveness","Challenges in enacting mitigation efforts in the absence of epidemics and high numbers of human cases","Lack of incorporation of community-based approaches and diverse issues in vbd strategies","Inadequate response to global commitments in addressing vbd scenarios","Lack of political will and funding for scale-up of disease prevention and control tools","Challenge in scaling-up, financing, and institutionalizing community empowerment approaches to vector-borne diseases","Uncertainty and ambiguity in epidemiological trends and impact of prevention efforts","Lack of social science integration in disease control policies and programs","Focus on single diseases in surveillance systems"]}
